intro: Spermacoce discreta, commonly known as the small false mallow, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and the Americas. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant features opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves with hairy surfaces, and its flowers are small, white or pale pink, arranged in clusters. Spermacoce discreta produces small, round, black seeds enclosed in a capsule, which is a characteristic feature of the Rubiaceae family. It is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along stream banks.
